answers.answer: Just remember those are estimates.. How did they estimate it measuring your tummy or ultrasound.  I had gd with my first had a big tummy dr measured me and told me she would  be 9lbs.   I had a 5 lb healthy baby girl at 39weeks.

I'm gd every preg,my little girl who was born six yrs ago,they predicted her to b ten pounds she was born 38 weeks induced she was 6 lb 2oz ,they can get it wrong,I've got my qrowth scan tomorrow ,can't wait to see her ,I'm 32 weeks

ive got it. and at 31 wks i was estimated at 4.5 lbs and thats just it its an estimate. my hope is still to have a natural vaginal delivery. ill have a c section if during the course of pushing i make no progress otherwise i think our bodies are capable of wonderful things. tones of women have had 10 lbs babies vaginal with no problems. if they are very concerned with babies weight they'll probbaly induce you early to limit the weight gained by the baby generally at about 38 wks which should make a natural delivery easier. but as ladies have mentioned they typically over estimated baby weight and why rush it when they could be completely wrong. i think a 9lbs baby is completely healthy and normal (i was expecting a big baby even before the diagnosis,  my family makes them big lol) . id much rather have a 9lbs baby then 7lbs.sadly i think its alittle bit of a scare tactic on the drs part to tell you that your baby is going to be huge and then put doubts in your mind about what your capable of so you are scared into a scheduled c-section which is easier for them. do what feel right for you and your baby. hope that helps!
I was told I have gestational diabetes and so nervous I'm gonna have a big baby. I'm a small girl. I'm 31 weeks and my baby boy weighed 3lbs 1oz at my 30 week ultra sound check up.
My pregnancy book says 3lbs is normal for 30weeks. I think the app does too.. My baby last time born at 30weeks was 2lbs 13oz. They said she was small
I was told i have gestational diabetes also ... they did ultrasound yesterday and told me baby is 4lbs and 9 oz i am 32weeks will be 33weeks in three days... very nervous about gestational diabetes

question: Hi just wondering if anybody else has been diagnosed with GD? I am 32+1 and at 31+4 was told my baby weighed 5lb 1oz already. Don't know whether to opt for s c section as I don't want her to be too big to push out.
title: gestational diabetes
